title: The Gardener's Gift: A Lesson in Stewardship
sub_title: Tending to What We've Been Given
devotional:
Old Man Hemlock, as the locals called him, wasn't known for his jovial spirit. His brow was perpetually furrowed, and his words were few. He lived in a small, weathered cabin nestled on the edge of town, seemingly content with his solitude. What most people didn't know was that Old Man Hemlock possessed a green thumb unlike any other. His small garden, though hidden from the main road, was a vibrant explosion of color and life. Tomatoes plump and red, rows of corn standing tall and proud, and herbs that perfumed the air with their fragrant oils—all thrived under his meticulous care. He didn't sell his produce, nor did he flaunt it. Instead, silently, week after week, he would leave baskets overflowing with fresh vegetables and herbs on the doorsteps of families in need, particularly the elderly and those struggling to make ends meet.

One sweltering August afternoon, a young boy named Billy, known for his mischievous nature, snuck into Old Man Hemlock's garden. He planned to snatch a few ripe tomatoes, but as he crept through the rows, he noticed the old man carefully tending to a wilting sunflower. Hemlock gently propped up the heavy head of the flower, whispering words of encouragement. Billy, hidden behind a row of corn, watched in amazement. He had never seen the gruff old man display such tenderness. Overcome with guilt, Billy emerged from his hiding place, confessing his intention to steal.

To Billy's surprise, Hemlock didn't scold him. Instead, he smiled, a rare sight that transformed his face. "These tomatoes aren't just mine, son," he said, handing Billy a basket. "They're a gift, meant to be shared. But true stewardship isn't just about what you take; it's about what you give back. How will you tend to what you've been given?"
image_description: An overflowing basket of ripe tomatoes and herbs sitting on a wooden doorstep next to a small, colorful garden.
insights: The parable of the talents in Matthew 25:14-30 illustrates the essence of stewardship. Each servant was given talents according to his ability and was expected to make wise use of them. Similarly, 1 Peter 4:10 states, 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God’s grace in its various forms.' Our resources, abilities, and time are all gifts entrusted to us by God, and we are accountable for how we manage them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, thank you for the abundance in my life – the gifts, talents, resources, and time you have bestowed upon me. Help me to be a faithful steward of all that you have entrusted to my care. Guide me to use these blessings wisely, not just for my own benefit, but for the good of others and the glory of your name. Show me where I can give back and tend to that which You have entrusted to me. Amen.
reflection: What are some of the resources, talents, or opportunities that God has entrusted to you? How are you currently using them? What steps can you take to become a more faithful and generous steward of these blessings? How can you ensure you are giving back to God and others?
